Uses of Class
projectpokemon.logic.Move

    • Uses of Move in projectpokemon.logic

      Methods in projectpokemon.logic that return Move 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Move MoveFactory.getMove(int id)
      Returns the move with the given ID
      Methods in projectpokemon.logic that return types with arguments of type Move 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<Move> Pokemon.getMoveSet()
      Returns the pokemon's moveset
      Methods in projectpokemon.logic with parameters of type Move 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Battle.applyStages(Move chosenMove, Pokemon attacker, Pokemon defender)
      Applies the chosenMove's StatStages to both the attacking pokemon, meaning it will receive the SelfStatStages, and the defending pokemon, that will receive the EnemyStatStages.
      double Battle.calculateDamage(Pokemon attacker, Pokemon defender, Move chosenMove, double modifier, boolean critical)
      Calculates and returns the damage caused by the attacking pokemon's move on the defender.
      double Battle.calculateModifier(Pokemon attacker, Pokemon defender, Move chosenMove, boolean critical)
      Calculates and returns the modifier that will be further used to calculate the damage that the defending pokemon will take.
      double BattleAI.calculateScore(Move move, Pokemon self, Pokemon target)
      Calculates and returns the score of a move, given the pokemon that will use it (self) and the one it will be used against (target).
      boolean Battle.isCritical(Move move)
      Based on the move's chance to be critical returns if the move will critically strike or not.
      boolean Battle.isSTAB(Move move, Pokemon self)
      Returns true if the given move is STAB and false otherwise.
      boolean BattleAI.isSuperEffectiveAgainst(Move move, Pokemon target)
      Returns true if the given move is super effective against the target
      double Battle.modifierAgainst(Move move, Pokemon target)
      Calculates and returns the modifier of a move against a target pokemon, based on the move's type and the pokemon's type(s).
      boolean Battle.moveHits(Pokemon attacker, Pokemon defender, Move chosenMove)
      Calculates if the move is going to hit or not based on the move's accuracy, the attacking pokemon's accuracy modifier and the defending pokemon's evasion modifier.
      void Battle.setEffectiveness(Move move, Pokemon target, Trainer who)
      Sets the Effectiveness attributes in the BattleVariables according to the effectiveness of the move used by the given Trainer's pokemon on the foe.
